title: Medical Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and straight forward. This process involved several rounds and multiple people. All were nice to talk to and came with good questions. Some Multi person interviews and some individual.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Great! They were all super nice and friendly. It is a good environment, very clean and everyone is soo welcoming. Met with HR first then met with the physicians and person I would be working for. All interviews were in person, Zoom wasn't an option.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was great.  Recruiter called and set up a date. 2 days later I'm on the interview.  Met with recruiter first.  Then the hiring manager and the assistant in same day. Very nice people.  Seems like a great company.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a difficult patient and what you did

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Short and followed with a tour of the unit. Hiring was also very quick process.  Accessing the HR department is a little tricky. Ask for directions if you get lost
Interview Questions: Questions about prior nursing experience

title: MEDICAL BILLING Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Met with the woman who hired me and ended up being my direct supervisor. We clicked right away. The job offered good variety and there was great support within my department.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my future career goals.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital (Concord, MA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy, I met with the recruiter first and explained my past experience in the position and some of the roles I did . We talked a little bit more about my resumé and important aspects of being a patient care technician and the work culture. I then met with the charge nurse if the floor I would be working on and she explained to me the demand of the floor and my responsibilities. We discussed how my skills from previous employers and experiences were transferable to this position. And finally discussed orientation overview and what was to expect next in the hiring process.
Interview Questions: What were some of your responsibilities as an HHA?

title: MHC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: very inviting and very personable. the staff seemed very informed and also warmly welcomed by other staff as we were touring the facility. through the interview, the manager was very kind and informative, and also gave me an opportunity to answer questions or concerns I may have had. Overall a very great interview and a great place to work as well.
Interview Questions: What are some qualities you believe will help you in this position?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very quick, meet with HR and then head of department you are looking to work for. Went for a tour of the department and told me they would be in touch.
Interview Questions: Share an experience where you were challenged at work in the past.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very quick process, extremely kind and professional staff from the secretaries to the medical director. HR is very responsive to calls and emails and are in constant contact with you to be sure things are moving along
Interview Questions: What I’m looking for in my career

title: Clinical Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I met with HR first then i met with the practice manager, after that i met with office manager and the doctors i would be supporting. doctor was great. once i got hired i had to do some drug testing and make sure all vaccines were up to date. it was a pretty easy interview process
Interview Questions: why i wanted the job

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: They reached out to me and told me about opportunities available. Screened me on the phone. Brought in to talk with some managers and was offered the job not too long after.
Interview Questions: What are you looking to gain out of this experience?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Barely asked screening questions. They were so desperate and short staffed so the hiring manager pretty much focused on scheduling/start date. Sold the unit pretty well. Said assignments were pretty fair (which they didnt end up being at all)
Interview Questions: Barely asked any real interview questions. They were so desperate they pretty much focused on scheduling/start date

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital (Concord, MA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Online application, phone call from HR, meeting with HR and then with Unit Manager.
Met with them spoke for about an hour.  Manager to,d me right there they were interested. She would have HR contact me regarding refs
Interview Questions: Why I would be a good for for the job

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital (West Concord, MA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Comfortable and down to earth, it was easy to express myself. Questions asked were realistic and practical. HR was helpful in answering questions that I had too and were knowledgeable about benefits.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with difficult providers?

title: Observation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Conversation style interview with HR in the office. Very laid back and  comfortable setting, with straight forward questions. Curious and supportive, but not overly pressing about any personal information.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online during the weekend and got a call first thing Monday morning for an interview. Had an interview that week. This was a two part process, first with HR and then with the manager and crew of the department I was looking to work in. Although the second portion being a group interview was a little bit intimidating, I felt that everyone was still very pleasant. I was offered the position approximately one week later.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had difficulty with another coworker. How did you handle it and what was the outcome?

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital (Wayland, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Overall positive experience. Bothe HR and the hiring manager were extremely professional but friendly. They were very informative and offered great insight into the working environment at the hospital as well as the department itself.
Interview Questions: Can you recall a negative experience with a past coworker or client and how you resolved that situation

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital (Concord, MA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a two part interview, first with HR and then second with the direct managers of the project. Interview with HR was average but interview with managers was very short. It was clear after the interview that I was their last choice candidate before my interview began, solely based on my resume.
Interview Questions: Discuss a time where you had a conflict. How did you resolve it?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital (Concord, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Human Resources was so nice and welcoming. Multiple members of the team welcomed me. The interview process was nice. The recruiter was very pleasant and informative, her demeanor helped me to relax as I was very nervous. Then I met with the Manager who again, was very kind. She told me all about the Unit and let me take a tour. I left with a big smile on my face, I knew I wanted to work here!
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult situation at work and how you handled it.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Interviewed first with HR specialist then panel interview with hiring manger and staff. Everyone was nice and laid back. I knew it was going to be a good fit.
Interview Questions: standard nursing job questions.

title: Social Work Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Apply on website, HR screens applicants, interviews, and sets up interview with units.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Radiology Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Quick and simple.
Interview Questions: Most difficult patient experience.

title: Admin Ass't Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital (Concord, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line. Took a while to get an interview. Felt like I was interviewing for a job above the position of an admin. ass't.
Interview Questions: How do you handle people you don't get along with? What was your biggest challenge at your last job? How do you deal with an angry person?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson Hospital (West Concord, MA) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions:
Easy to do.  
Fill out an on-line application
Interview
Get hired!
Interview Questions: Tell me something that you failed at and what did you learn from it
